title: Calories in a Cupcake
meta_description: Discover calories in a cupcake, including carbs, fat, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Standard vanilla cupcake (~45g cake) with buttercream frosting (~15g), baked from mix, average size; no fillings or decorations.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, size, frosting type, brand, and baking method. Check labels for packaged cupcakes.

quick_answer.text: A typical frosted cupcake contains about 290 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Chocolate cupcake with cream cheese frosting

faqs.q: How many calories in a cupcake without frosting?
faqs.a: About 170 kcal for a plain vanilla cupcake.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a frosted cupcake?
faqs.a: Around 38 g carbs, with 28 g sugars, per standard serving.
Yes, typically 14 g total fat including 6 g saturated from frosting and butter.

faqs.q: How does size affect calories in a cupcake?
faqs.a: Larger cupcakes can add 100+ kcal; minis are about half.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in a cupcake?
faqs.a: Low, around 2.5 g per frosted cupcake.
